definitions: deep respect and admiration earned through achievement or character
personal integrity and ethical principles that guide one's actions
examples: The ceremony was held in honor of fallen soldiers
She received the highest honor from the university
He maintained his honor despite the difficult circumstances
Their family values honor above material wealth

definitions: artistic, literary, or musical creations produced by someone
industrial facility where manufacturing or processing takes place
examples: The museum displays the complete works of Van Gogh
Her literary works have been translated into many languages
The steel works employs thousands of local residents
They visited the old iron works near the river

definitions: main subject or idea explored in a work of art or discussion
recurring element or pattern in music, literature, or design
examples: The theme of the conference is sustainable development
Love and betrayal are common themes in Shakespeare's plays
The composer introduced a new theme in the second movement
The party decorations followed a tropical theme throughout

definitions: individual with XY chromosomes and typically masculine physical characteristics
person who identifies with masculine gender regardless of biological sex
examples: The male lion has a distinctive mane around his neck
Male birds often have brighter plumage than females
He identified as male from an early age
The form asks applicants to specify male or female

definitions: artificial basin filled with water for swimming or decoration
shared collection of resources, money, or participants available for use
examples: The children spent all afternoon playing in the swimming pool
They installed a small pool in their backyard garden
The company created a pool of temporary workers
All prize money goes into a pool for distribution

definitions: small bag sewn into clothing for carrying small items
small isolated area or group within a larger space
examples: He kept his wallet in his back pocket
Her jacket has deep pockets for storing gloves
They discovered pockets of resistance in the occupied territory
Small pockets of poverty exist throughout the wealthy region

definitions: sweet crystalline substance obtained from plants used in food
affectionate nickname used when addressing someone dear
examples: She added two teaspoons of sugar to her coffee
The recipe calls for brown sugar instead of white
Come here, sugar, and give me a hug
The waitress called everyone sugar with Southern charm

definitions: profession or activity of educating students in schools or universities
religious or philosophical principles passed down through instruction
examples: Her teaching methods engage students through interactive activities
He devoted thirty years to teaching high school mathematics
The teachings of Buddha emphasize compassion and mindfulness
They follow the ancient teachings of their ancestors

definitions: person who presides over meetings and organizational proceedings
highest-ranking executive who leads a company's board of directors
examples: The chairman called the meeting to order at noon
She served as chairman of the planning committee
The board elected a new chairman after the retirement
The company chairman announced record profits this quarter

definitions: action or judgment that is mistaken or incorrect
difference between a measured value and the true value
examples: The student found an error in the textbook
Human error caused the accident at the factory
The margin of error in the poll is three percent
Statistical errors can affect the validity of research

definitions: structure built to span physical obstacles like water or valleys
something that connects or links different things, people, or ideas
examples: The Golden Gate Bridge connects San Francisco to Marin County
They built a wooden bridge across the stream
Music can serve as a bridge between different cultures
The program bridges the gap between theory and practice

definitions: reproductive structure of flowering plants with colorful petals
period of greatest success, productivity, or beauty in something
examples: She picked fresh flowers from the garden every morning
The cherry trees produce beautiful pink flowers in spring
The Renaissance was the flower of European artistic achievement
In the flower of her youth, she traveled the world

definitions: all existing matter, space, and energy considered as a whole
particular sphere of activity, interest, or experience
examples: Scientists study the origins of the universe through telescopes
The universe contains billions of galaxies and countless stars
In the universe of fashion, trends change rapidly
She created her own universe through her novels

definitions: point or level beyond which something cannot or should not go
restriction or constraint placed on actions, behavior, or resources
examples: The speed limit on this highway is sixty-five miles per hour
They pushed their endurance to the absolute limit
The government imposed limits on carbon emissions
Credit cards have daily withdrawal limits for security

definitions: extent and quality of reporting on events by news media
extent to which something is covered by insurance, warranty, or protection
examples: The election received extensive coverage in national newspapers
Live coverage of the event begins at eight o'clock
Their health insurance provides comprehensive coverage for emergencies
The warranty coverage includes parts and labor costs

definitions: group of people working together on a ship, aircraft, or project
informal group of friends or associates who spend time together
examples: The film crew worked eighteen-hour days to finish shooting
The ship's crew prepared for the storm ahead
He always hangs out with the same crew on weekends
My crew and I are planning a road trip

definitions: state of equal distribution of weight or forces enabling stability
amount of money remaining in an account after transactions
examples: She lost her balance and fell off the bicycle
Yoga helps improve balance and flexibility
The account balance shows five hundred dollars remaining
Please pay the outstanding balance by month end

definitions: either of the two fleshy parts forming the edges of the mouth
edge or rim of a container, cavity, or other opening
examples: She applied red lipstick to her lips carefully
He bit his lower lip when concentrating
Pour the milk carefully over the lip of the jug
The cup has a chip on its lip

definitions: area distinguished by particular characteristics, purpose, or restrictions
mental state of complete focus and optimal performance
examples: Parking is prohibited in the loading zone during business hours
The city created a pedestrian-only zone downtown
Athletes often enter the zone during peak performance
She was in the zone while writing her novel

definitions: ceremony where two people are united in marriage
act of joining or combining different elements together
examples: Their wedding took place in a beautiful garden setting
The wedding reception lasted until midnight
The wedding of traditional and modern styles created unique architecture
This represents a wedding of art and technology

definitions: thing made to be similar or identical to another
written material intended for publication or broadcast
examples: Please make three copies of this document for the meeting
This painting is a copy of the original masterpiece
The editor reviewed the copy before sending it to print
Submit your advertising copy by Friday deadline

definitions: something said or done to provoke laughter or amusement
person or thing that is ridiculously inadequate or absurd
examples: He told a funny joke that made everyone laugh
She loves sharing jokes at family gatherings
The outdated computer system is a complete joke
Calling this place a restaurant is a joke

definitions: regular occasion when food is eaten, typically breakfast, lunch, or dinner
coarsely ground grain or pulse used as food ingredient
examples: The family gathers for their evening meal at six
She prepared a delicious three-course meal for guests
Add corn meal slowly while stirring the mixture
Almond meal can replace flour in some recipes

definitions: smaller number or part representing less than half of the whole
state or period of being under the age of legal majority
examples: Women remain a minority in senior management positions
The proposal was supported by only a minority of voters
During his minority, his uncle managed the estate
The trust fund becomes available when she reaches majority

definitions: faculty or power of seeing with the eyes
thing that is seen, especially something remarkable or worth seeing
examples: Her sight deteriorated as she grew older
The accident affected his sight in one eye
The sunset over the ocean was a beautiful sight
Tourist buses stop at all the famous sights

definitions: natural periodic state of rest for mind and body with closed eyes
period of inactivity or dormancy in organisms or systems
examples: Most adults need seven to eight hours of sleep nightly
The baby finally fell into a deep sleep
Bears enter a long sleep during winter months
The volcano remained in sleep for centuries

definitions: one-piece garment for women consisting of skirt and bodice
style or manner of clothing worn by a person or group
examples: She wore a blue dress to the wedding reception
The dress fits perfectly after the alterations
Traditional dress varies greatly between different cultures
The company relaxed its dress code last year

definitions: action of setting free from confinement or restraint
making something available to the public for the first time
examples: The release of the prisoners was negotiated carefully
Pull the lever to release the emergency brake
The movie release is scheduled for next Friday
The band announced the release of their new album

definitions: financial gain from business after subtracting costs and expenses
advantage or benefit gained from something
examples: The company reported record profits this quarter
Small businesses struggle to make consistent profit
She read the book twice for greater profit
There's little profit in arguing about past mistakes

definitions: social and cultural differences between male and female identities
grammatical classification of nouns and pronouns in some languages
examples: The study examines gender roles in modern society
Gender equality remains an important workplace issue
In Spanish, nouns have either masculine or feminine gender
German has three genders: masculine, feminine, and neuter

definitions: narrow strip of material with adhesive for binding or sealing
magnetic strip for recording and playing back audio or video
examples: Use tape to seal the package before shipping
She wrapped the gift with decorative tape
They found old recordings on cassette tape
The interview was captured on tape for evidence

definitions: vast body of salt water covering most of Earth's surface
immense expanse or quantity of something
examples: Ships cross the ocean carrying cargo between continents
The Pacific Ocean is the largest on Earth
She felt an ocean of grief after the loss
An ocean of possibilities lay before them

definitions: person who receives or entertains guests socially or professionally
large number of people or things
examples: The host greeted each guest at the door personally
She played host to visitors from around the world
A host of problems emerged during the project
The festival attracted a host of talented performers

definitions: fact or condition connected with an event or action
person's financial or material situation in life
examples: Under normal circumstances, delivery takes three days
The circumstances surrounding her death remain mysterious
Their circumstances improved after finding steady employment
People of modest circumstances struggled during the recession

definitions: person in charge of workers or an organization
round raised ornament or stud on a surface
examples: She meets with her boss every Monday morning
The boss announced new policies at the meeting
The shield was decorated with metal bosses
Each boss on the ceiling adds architectural interest

definitions: hot drink made by infusing dried leaves in boiling water
light afternoon meal typically including tea and small foods
examples: She prefers green tea over coffee in the morning
Would you like sugar or honey in your tea
They served afternoon tea with sandwiches and scones
High tea includes more substantial food items

definitions: way in which something is done or happens
person's outward bearing or way of behaving toward others
examples: She explained the procedure in a clear manner
The problem can be solved in several different manners
His polite manner impressed everyone at the dinner
Good manners are important in professional settings

definitions: rate, number, or amount in each hundred
share of profits or commission based on sales
examples: The percentage of students passing increased this year
What percentage of income goes to taxes
Sales representatives earn a percentage on each deal
His percentage of the profits was clearly stated

definitions: visible mass of water droplets suspended in the atmosphere
network of remote servers for storing and accessing data online
examples: Dark clouds gathered before the storm arrived
White fluffy clouds drifted across the blue sky
She saves all her photos to the cloud
Cloud computing reduces the need for physical servers

definitions: person or team that wins a contest or competition
thing that is successful or likely to be successful
examples: The winner received a gold medal and cash prize
They announced the lottery winner on live television
This new product looks like a real winner
The movie was a winner at the box office

definitions: set of words expressing a complete thought with subject and predicate
punishment assigned to a defendant found guilty by a court
examples: Every sentence should begin with a capital letter
This paragraph contains five sentences
The judge imposed a ten-year sentence for the crime
She served her sentence at the state prison

definitions: act of asking politely or formally for something
formal written or verbal application for something
examples: She made a request for additional time off
The manager denied his request for a raise
Submit your request through the online portal
Freedom of information requests must be processed promptly

definitions: way that someone or something looks to other people
act of appearing in public or arriving somewhere
examples: His appearance improved after the new haircut
The building's appearance deteriorated over the years
She made a brief appearance at the charity event
The actor's appearance caused excitement among fans

definitions: white crystalline substance used to season and preserve food
chemical compound formed from acid and base reaction
examples: Add a pinch of salt to enhance the flavor
Sea salt contains trace minerals from ocean water
Table salt is sodium chloride, a simple salt
Different salts have various industrial applications

definitions: quality of being pleasing to the senses or mind aesthetically
person or thing that is beautiful or attractive
examples: The beauty of the sunset took their breath away
She appreciated beauty in art and nature
The car is a real beauty with classic lines
Local beauties competed in the pageant

definitions: container with narrow neck used for storing liquids
person's courage or confidence to do something
examples: She drank water from a plastic bottle
The wine bottle held exactly seven hundred fifty milliliters
He lost his bottle at the crucial moment
It takes bottle to perform in front of thousands

definitions: part or element that combines with others to form something complete
discrete electronic part used in electronic circuits or devices
examples: Trust is an essential component of any relationship
Each component must be tested before final assembly
The technician replaced the faulty component
Electronic components are becoming smaller each year

definitions: payment made for professional services or privileges
inherited estate in land held in absolute ownership
examples: The lawyer charges an hourly fee for consultations
University fees have increased significantly this year
He inherited the property in fee simple
The estate was held in fee by the family

definitions: series of movements performed to music using the body rhythmically
social gathering where people dance to music
examples: She studied dance at the performing arts academy
Their first dance as newlyweds was memorable
The school dance is scheduled for next Friday
They met at a dance in the town hall

definitions: garment for the upper body with sleeves and collar
sports uniform top worn by team members
examples: He ironed his white shirt for the interview
She prefers cotton shirts over synthetic materials
The player wore the number ten shirt proudly
Fans bought replica shirts of their favorite team
